intro: Deyeuxia tolucensis, commonly known as the Tolucan sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial grass-like plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Native to South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. The plant has fibrous roots and produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small vertebrates.
